page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: The area we were given to study as our contribution to the Domesday survey is mainly countryside. We had hoped to be given somewhere close to school but in fact the nearest point is about 7 miles from school. This caused some transport problems, particularly as due to teacher action it was not as easy to take groups of children out of school. The most northwesterly part of our area is bordered by Denby Dale, to the south west are Gunthwaite and Ingbirchworth, and to the east is Cawthorne. There are no major settlements in the area and most of the hamlets are no more than 3 houses. We found the study very enjoyable although an area with more industry and housing will probably provide a greater insight into contemporary Britain.
